title.narrative: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, EPA Regional Offices: Binational Stakeholder Engagement for Nutrients in the Lake Erie Basin

description.narrative: This project will support binational efforts to engage farmers, lake shoreline residents, and urban residents to implement Best Management Practices to reduce nutrient runoff to Lake Erie. It will analyze barriers and incentives for participation in nutrient runnoff reduction initiatives, and use a social marketing strategy to encourage implementation of Best Management Practices for nutrients.

person-name.narrative: Glen Cuscino and April Bullock; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Environmental Protection Agency, Environmental Programs and Management

title.narrative: Environmental Protection Agency, Office of Chemical Safety and Pollution Prevention (OCSPP), Support to the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development's (OECD's) work on the Environmenal Health and Safety Programme.

description.narrative: The Objective of this grant is to provide financial support to the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development's (OECD's) work on the Environmenal Health and Safety Programme. The effort will support work on test guidelines; the assessment of chemicals and nanomaterials; capacity building; facilitation of risk reduction; chemical accidents and pollutant release and transfer registers.

participating-org.narrative: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (Contributions to special funds for Technical Co-operation Activities Only)

person-name.narrative: Glen Cuscino and April Bullock; Ryan Boles

receiver-org.narrative: Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (Contributions to special funds for Technical Co-operation Activities Only)

title.narrative: Environmental Protection Agency, Office of International and Tribal Affairs (OITA), Commitment to the Commission for Environmental Cooperation

description.narrative: Provides support to the CEC which facilitates collaboration and public participation to foster conservation, protection and enhancement of the North American environment for the benefit of present and future generations, in the context of increasing economic, trade, and social links among Canada, Mexico, and the United States.

title.narrative: U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, Office of International and Tribal Affairs (OITA): North American Agreement on Environmental Cooperation (NAAEC)

description.narrative: In the U.S., EPA plays a role in ensuring trade related activities sustain environmental protection. Growing U.S. global trade underscores the importance of addressing potential adverse environmental consequences. To foster the protection and improvement of the environment in the region, NAAECs creation represented a commitment by the U.S., Canada, and Mexico to integrate environmental protection considerations into their trade negotiations.

person-name.narrative: Glen Cuscino and April Bullock; Ryan Boles
